data.title: Lots of information about Flagstaff and the surrounding area
data.text: We wanted to get a quick feel for downtown Flagstaff and its history and this was the right place to see.  Lots of brochures and helpful staff to answer your questions.

data.title: Good information provided
data.text: Good service, lots of maps and detail provided, free wifi, some souvenirs - what more could you ask from a visitors center?!

data.title: Great Visitor's Center
data.text: Stopped in to get information on the Flagstaff area and was very pleased to see the large selection of information as well as a well stocked gift shop for souvenirs that were very reasonably priced.  The Center also had a penny machine for flattening pennies that my grandkids like to collect.  The Center is at the railroad in historic downtown Flagstaff and is a lovely setting. Free parking also.  A short walk down the historic route 66 and you can get a picture of the Route 66 sign (there is also a blown up sign in front of the Visitor's Center.

data.title: Great Visit
data.text: Friendly people, clean, places to sit and visit, watch the trains going by. Many free magazines and other handouts, big selections of gifts.

data.title: Lots of useful information
data.text: Easy to get to, has parking, has lots of useful information on what to do and where to go, and is downtown so easy to go from here to get lunch or whatever.

data.title: Very Friendly & Knowledgeable!
data.text: My family stopped here while visiting Flagstaff. We were most impressed with their wealth of information, and knowledge of the area.  Excellent information and advice regarding hiking The Grand Canyon.  They have a great selection of post cards, and other souvenirs as well.

data.title: The Best!
data.text: We all found something in the gift shop and learned a lot about Flagstaff. The staff were friendly and enticed us to visit the tram at the Snowbowl the next day.

data.title: Information
data.text: The staff were very helpful and gave us advice and leaflets. Visitors centre had a model train running round room up high.

data.title: All aboard!!
data.text: Centrally located in downtown Flagstaff,Arizona where Route 66 and Milton Road meet. Make sure to take pictures of this renovated place which still been used as a train depot! Here you will find a little history of How The City of Flagstaff was founded. Commercial trains pass by every ten minutes or so with lots of cargo going East or West and better yet,Amtrak has a stop here! So if you want to get a train ticket from Los Angeles to Chicago,this is the place. All aboard!

data.title: Great location
data.text: The visitor center was an excellent place to see what the area had to offer and its right off of Route 66.

data.title: Fun stop while wandering Flagstaff
data.text: We stopped in while wandering around Flagstaff. We were greeted and asked if we needed any help or ideas of where to go and what to do. We watched the little toy train go around the interior of the building while our 1 year old chased it, waving and yelling, "Hi, choo-choo!" When we tried to leave, our daughter spotted a little toy deer and began crying when we set it down to leave. One of the employees saw what was going on and gave her one to keep. She did not need to do that, I would've happily paid for it. But it was so sweet of her and we really appreciate her gesture of kindness.

data.title: This should be your first stop
data.text: Staff was so friendly and helpful. Told  them we were only here for a few days so they suggested all the must see attractions. Left with a lot of knowledge and brochures. The train station is also here.

data.title: Flagstaff Update: 2016
data.text: When I went earlier on Labor Day, I saw their inflatable. It was so cool. I went in May for Train Day, and Flag has sure changed a bit. I still recommend you go to the depot before its too late!!

data.title: Good place to get info
data.text: We really found a lot of info there that were very useful for our trip. The service were friendly and professional.

data.title: So helpful
data.text: The gentleman who helped us provided great information and was very responsive to our needs.  The building is lovely and also houses the train station.  Caution!!! If you have children keep them at your side.  The train tracks are acceptable and marked by a caution line.  Trains pass  or should I say zoom by continuously day and night.  A great place for some photo ops.

data.title: Very Helpful
data.text: Great place to start to get maps and brochures of the area. Located at the Amtrak station the ladies are very friendly and informative and have good suggestions for things to do in the area. You can sit out front and watch the cargo trains go by and there's also some very reasonably priced Rt66/Flagstaff souvenirs there too.

data.title: Friendly, helpful and willing to help you plan all of your activities
data.text: Located within the Flagstaff Amtrak Station, the Visitor Center has a multitude of brochures, maps, handouts and, of course, well informed and friendly staff available to answer your questions, make suggestions and help you make the most of your visit to northern Arizona.

data.title: Surprised
data.text: This railway station is full of places to see and visit in the area. The staff was outstanding giving directions, suggestions and pleasant conversation about the center, the area and the town. There were discount coupons for nearly attraction.

data.title: Good starting point
data.text: This is a good starting point for information on the Grand Canyon and for answers to any questions you might have. The staff was very professional and knowledgeable. There are a few souvenirs for the grand canyon and route 66. It is located in an old (but still active) train station

data.title: Very useful and friendly
data.text: We took the scenic drive from Sedona to Flagstaff and since this was our first visit to Flagstaff, we stopped at the visitor center. The center is in an old train station waiting room. Amtrak still operates in one section but they have maintained the historic look of the station. There are many brochures and people to help. You need to sign in if you want to talk to a person. There are two stores inside. One is a train store and the other is dedicated to Route 66 items. It was our first time on a portion of Route 66. Good place to start a visit in Flagstaff.
